name: to use sth for a purpose

children.name: unused x
children.definition: unused sth that is unused, has not been used, especially because it has not been needed: chưa được dùng
examples: ▪ any unused wool can be returned to the shop.
▪ unused ammunition was dumped by us planes over laos.
▪ the safe disposal of unused stocks of pharmaceutical products

children.name: disused x
children.definition: disused especially uk a disused factory, mine, railway etc is old and not used any more: không được sử dụng nữa
examples: ▪ the drugs were found in a disused warehouse.
▪ they have been given a grant to convert the disused church into luxury flats.

children.name: idle c1
children.definition: idle not working or producing anything: : không hoạt động
examples: stand/sit/lie idleđứng chết
i cannot afford to leave the land lying idle .
the whole team stood idle , waiting for the mechanic.
most of the factory stood idle during the strike.
the new machines may sit idle for months until they have been paid for.
why is millions of pounds worth of state-of-the-art equipment lying idle?

children.name: gather dust x
children.definition: gather dust if sth such as a machine or a plan gathers dust, it is not being used, especially when it could be useful: đóng bụi, bị bỏ xó
examples: some of the new equipment is just gathering dust because the staff have not been trained to use it.
the plans lie gathering dust in some government office.

children.name: fall into disuse x
children.definition: fall into disuse if sth falls into disuse, people gradually stop using it because they no longer need or want it: bị bỏ đi, không dùng đến
examples: the canal system fell into disuse around the end of the nineteenth century.
when the old woman died, the house fell into disuse.

children.name: to use particular tools, objects, building, etc
use a1
children.definition: use dùng
examples: do you mind if i use your phone?
are we allowed to use a dictionary in the test?
they rebuilt the church using local stone.
easy/difficult/simple etc to use
drop-down menus make the program very easy to use.
use sth to do sth
use a calculator to check your answers.
use sth for doing sth
we use the shed for storing our firewood.
use sth as sth
we decided to use the second bedroom as a junk room.

children.name: with a2
children.definition: with/wɪð, wɪθ/  if you do sth with a tool, piece of equipment etc you use a tool, piece of equipment etc to do it: với
examples: ▪ beat the egg with a fork.
▪ do you have anything i can open the bottle with?

children.name: make use of b2
children.definition: make use of to use sth you have available for a particular purpose: sử dụng
examples: to build the shelter, they had to make use of whatever bits of wood or plastic they could find.
make use of to do sth
the romans made use of volcanic ash to produce concrete.
make use of sth as
who were the first to make use of pigeons as messengers?

children.name: usable x
children.definition: usable something that is usable can be used, because it works well or because it has been made ready for use: có thể sử dụng
examples: ▪ i know the bicycle’s old, but it’s still usable.
▪ the refinery turns crude oil into usable products such as gas and tar.
▪ the program has some nice features that make it more usable than most.

children.name: what sth can be used for
use b1
children.definition: use/juːs/  a way in which something can be used:
examples: công dụng, tác dụng, mục đích
▪ robots have many different uses in modern industry.
▪ the land has been developed for tourism and other recreational uses.
use of mục đích của, tác dụng của
▪ the use of animals in scientific experiments

children.name: function b2
children.definition: function the purpose for which sth is intended or the way people use it: chức năng
examples: what is the function of literature in our society?
function of chức năng của
the main function of the bars is to protect the driver’s legs.

children.name: application c2
children.definition: application a practical use of sth, especially in science or industry: tính ứng dụng
examples: practical application
the research has many practical applications .
scientific research and its practical applications
application of/to/in
the applications of genetic engineering in agriculture
the possible applications of this invention are limitless.

children.name: misuse c1
children.definition: misuse to use something for the wrong purpose, or in the wrong way, often with harmful results : lạm dụng
examples: measures must be taken to prevent confidential data from being misused.
he is accused of misusing public funds.
even harmless drugs can be misused.
the term ‘schizophrenia’ is often misused.
there is concern that the judges might misuse their power.
misuse[c or u] c1 lạm dụng
opponents of genetic engineering see it as a misuse of scientific knowledge.

children.name: abuse x
children.definition: abuseto use something for the wrong purpose in a way that is harmful or morally wrong: lạm dụng
examples: abuse position/ trust/ etc
williams abused his position as mayor to give jobs to his friends.
morris abused the trust the firm had shown in him.
people who abuse the system
she is continually abusing her position/authority by getting other people to do things for her.
abuse alcohol/drugs
the proportion of drinkers who abuse alcohol is actually quite small.
abuser[c]
a child abuser
a drug/solvent abuser

children.name: to use particular methods skills, knowledge, etc
use a1
children.definition: use dùng, sử dụng
examples: researchers often use questionnaires in their work.
i can’t tell you what to do - you must use your own discretion.
use sth to do sth
the nurse must use her communication skills to make the patient feel at ease.
these new techniques are already being used to produce special effects in films.
use[u] sự sử dụng
there have been complaints about the use of excessive force by the police.

children.name: make use of b2
children.definition: make use of to use a method, skill, or piece of information that is available to you:
examples: people asked her why she didn’t make use of her musical talent and give singing lessons.
we might as well make good use of his expertise while he’s here.

children.name: put sth to use a2
children.definition: put sth to use to start to use sth, especially knowledge or a skill that has not been used before: dùng đến
examples: your knowledge of computers can finally be put to use when the office buys a new system next month.
when governments acquire personal information about people they always try to put it to political use.
put sth to good use
i finally feel that i can put all my education to good use in this job.

children.name: apply c1
children.definition: apply to use sth such as a method, idea, or system in a particular situation, activity, or process: ứng dụng, áp dụng
examples: apply sth to sth
new technology is being applied to almost every industrial process.
you can’t apply policies designed for a big country like the united states to a small country like cuba.
apply sth to do sth
there are several tests you can apply to find out how old a tree is.

children.name: utilize x
children.definition: utilize/utiliseuk  formal to use sth that is available to you: sử dụng, dùng
examples: employers must utilize their workers more effectively if the region is to become an economic success.
we must consider how best to utilize what resources we have.
registerin everyday english, people usually sayuserather thanutilize:

children.name: draw on c1
children.definition: draw on sth to use information, knowledge, or experience that you have learned in the past, in order to do sth more effectively: sử dụng, dùng
examples: as a teacher, she drew on her knowledge of her own children.
journalists draw on both published and unofficial information from many different sources.
it was a challenge, but luckily we had the experience to draw on.

children.name: exploit b2
children.definition: exploit to use sth as fully and effectively as possible in order to gain as much as possible from it: khai thác
examples: britain consistently fails to exploit the scientific discoveries made in its universities.
the country’s natural resources have not yet been fully exploited.

children.name: employ c1
children.definition: employ formalto use a particular method or skill in order to achieve something : sử dụng, tận dụng
examples: employ a method/technique/tactic etc
the surgeons employed a new technique.
they employed every means at their disposal(= every available method).
sophisticated statistical analysis was employed to obtain these results.
the report examines teaching methods employed in the classroom.
registerin everyday english, people usually sayusea method rather thanemploya method.

children.name: resort to sth c2
children.definition: resort to sth to do sth bad, extreme, or difficult because you cannot think of any other way to deal with a problem : dùng đến, sự dụng đến (ngoài ý muốn)
examples: we are prepared to resort to force if necessary.
resort to violence
extremists on both sides resort to violence.
i had to resort to violence/ threats to get my money.
officials fear that extremists mayresort to violence.
resort to doing sth
vets have had to resort to killing the animals.
when she didn't answer the phone, i resorted to calling up to her from the street.

children.name: fall back on c2
children.definition: fall back on sth with to use sth for help because no other choice is available: dùng đến, cậy dựa vào
examples: when the business failed, we had to fall back on our savings.
if i lose my job, i'll have nothing to fall back on.

children.name: to use a service that is available
use a1
children.definition: use dùng, sử dụng
examples: how often do you use the library?
now that we have a car we very rarely use the buses.
the hotel used to offer a baby-sitting service, but no one ever used it.
use[u] việc dùng
there has been a decline in the use of the subway system over recent years.

children.name: make use of b2
children.definition: make use of to use sth that is available, especially in order to enjoy it or to get sth that you want from it: sử dụng
examples: not enough people are making use of the company’s fitness centre.
make good use of sth
students are encouraged to make good use of all the computing facilities.

children.name: user b1
children.definition: user sb who uses sth: người dùng, người sử dụng
examples: software should be designed to be as accessible as possible to users.
computer userscomputer users are being warned to look out for the virus.
business usersthe hotel caters mainly to business users.
internet usersinternet users who illegally download music and films could face large fines.
road/phone/library etc user
drunken drivers are a menace to themselves and other road users.
a new information service will soon be available to library users.
end userthe person who uses a product
computers are sold direct to end users as well as through dealers.

children.name: to use a situation to gain an advantage
use c2
children.definition: use dùng
examples: use sth to do sth
she used her position as manager to get jobs for her friends.
the prisoners used the confusion caused by the fire to conceal their escape.
use sth for sth
charles was able to use his family connection for his own personal advancement.
use sth as sth
right-wing activists used people’s fear of unemployment as a way of stirring up extremism.

children.name: exploit b2
children.definition: exploit to use a situation in order to gain as much advantage for yourself as possible, especially in a way that people disapprove of: tận dụng, khai thác
examples: opposition leaders were quick to exploit government embarrassment over the incident.
exploit sth to do sth
the country could exploit its position as a major oil producer to push up world oil prices.

children.name: make use of b2
children.definition: make use of to use a situation in order to gain an advantage for yourself, especially when that situation has already existed for some time: sử dụng
examples: i made use of my old contacts to get a job when i come back from australia.
the republicans were making use of their large majority in congress to block legislation on taxes.

children.name: take advantage of b1
children.definition: take advantage of to use an opportunity in order to do what you want or need to do: tận dụng, lợi dụng
examples: shoppers flocked to take advantage of a supermarket price war which cut the price of many goods.
take advantage of to do sth
many small investors are taking advantage of these attractive share offers to make a quick profit.

children.name: play on x
children.definition: play on sthplay on sb’s fears/greed/sympathy/prejudices etcto use someone’s fears, sympathy etc in order to gain an advantage for yourself: lợi dụng nỗi sợ, lòng tham, sự thông cảm, định kiến
examples: a common sales tactic is to play on people’s greed in order to make them buy more than they need.
disguised as an electrician, he played on people’s trust to trick them out of money.

children.name: capitalize on x
children.definition: capitalize on sth to use a situation in order to gain an advantage and make yourself more successful or more effective: lợi dụng,
examples: teachers can capitalize on young children’s natural curiosity.
fail to capitalize on sth
the generals failed to capitalize on the weaknesses and divisions in the enemy camp.
capitalize on to do sth
will the president capitalize on his immense popularity to exert strong leadership?

children.name: reuse x
children.definition: reuse to use sth again : sử dụng lại
examples: the supermarket encourages shoppers to reuse plastic bags.
the bottles are designed to be reused up to 20 times.
the bottles are designed to be reused up to 20 times.
reusableadjective:
reusable containers
reuse[ u ] :
to purify water for reuse

children.name: to use your power or rights
exercise c2
children.definition: exercise formal to use a power, right, or quality that you have: sử dụng, hành sử
examples: parents sometimes need to exercise their authority and say ‘no’ to their children.
the congress must decide whether to exercise its veto or not.
many people are exercising their right to leave the state pension plan.
there are plans to encourage people to exercise their right to vote.
people who canexercisesomecontrolover their surroundings feel less anxious.

children.name: wield c2
children.definition: wield formalwield power/influence/authority etcto have a lot of power or influence, and to use it : nắm giữ
examples: the church wields immense power in ireland.
the central banks wield enormous power.

children.name: serve a purpose c2
children.definition: serve a purpose
examples: to have a use
_these small village shops serve a very useful purpose.

children.name: serve c1
children.definition: serveverbhelp achieve
examples: [ i or t ] to help achieve something or to be useful as something
_the minister said she did not consider that a public enquiry would serve any usefulpurpose.
_the judge said that the fine would serveasa warning to other motorists who drove without due care.
_in the absence of anything better the settee would serve (= could be used)asa bed for a couple of nights.
_[ + to infinitive]nothing servestoexplain the violent fighting we have seen recently.
_old-fashionedmy umbrella will servefora weapon.
